extension_description.message: Simplify your browsing by grouping unused tabs into organized groups

add_new_tab_to_last_active_group.message: Add new tab to last active group

clear_all_data_confirm.message: Are you sure you want to clear all data?

clear_all_data_confirm_description.message: This will delete all your saved tabs and groups. This action cannot be undone.

clean_up_junk_confirm.message: Are you sure you want to clean up junk?

clean_up_junk_confirm_description.message: This will delete empty tab groups and duplicate tabs. This action cannot be undone.

home_page_description.message: Simplify your browsing by preserving unused tabs into organized groups of virtual tabs and synchronize them with all devices.

no_preview_faq_q1.message: Why preview of this tab is not available?

no_preview_faq_a1.message: This tab is a part of tab group preservation.

no_preview_faq_a2.message: Preview has been disabled in settings.

no_preview_faq_a3.message: Tab was loaded from the cloud, but preview was saved locally. You can enable cloud preview saving in settings.

no_preview_faq_a4.message: Something went wrong. Try to restart browser, then restore and preserve tab again. If that doesn't help, you can enable cloud preview saving in settings.

about_title.message: Tabber – Ultimate Tab Organization Solution v$1

about_description.message:
Simplify your browsing by preserving unused tabs into organized groups of virtual tabs and synchronize them with all devices.
Visit the %Tabber About page% for more info.

plus_description.message: Upgrade your web browsing experience with Tabber Plus. Say goodbye to tab clutter and discover a world of productivity-enhancing tools that will transform the way you work online.

plus_feature_desc_1.message: No more limits to the number of tabs you can group.

plus_feature_desc_2.message: Enhanced AI model and higher usage limits.

plus_feature_desc_3.message: Your tabs are automatically synced across all your devices.

plus_feature_desc_4.message: Access your full synchronizations history and restore any backup.

plus_feature_desc_5.message: Apply a custom background to pages without previews.

plus_feature_desc_6.message: Any questions and concerns will be addressed promptly, ensuring a smooth experience.

plus_feature_desc_7.message: Get exclusive access to Patreon posts, polls and stay in the loop with the latest updates, tips, and tricks.

tab_group_limit.message: Upgrade to Tabber Plus to create more tab groups

sign_in_to_sync.message: Sign in to cloud sync your tabs

sign_in_to_save_previews.message: Sign in to cloud save previews

sync_from_cloud_description.message: You have tabs saved in cloud. You can merge them with your current tabs or replace them. If you choose to merge, your current tabs will be merged with cloud ones, duplicates will be omitted. If you choose to replace, all your current tabs will be lost.

restore_group_error.message: Can't create tab group. Your browser may not support this feature.

capture_tab_error.message: Can't capture tab. You may not allowed the required permissions.

request_permission_description.message: Tabber needs your permission to access your browser's tabs. This is required to make tabs previews. If you don't want to grant this permission, this feature will be disabled.

tutorial_welcome_description.message: Let's walk through a tutorial on using Tabber to get a better understanding of how it works.

tutorial_preserve_tab_description_1.message: 1. Go to the %link% or any other website.

tutorial_preserve_tab_description_2.message: 2. Click on the extension icon in the top right corner of your browser OR right click on the page.

tutorial_preserve_tab_description_5.message: 5. Click on the tab you preserved.

tutorial_preserve_tab_description_6.message: 6. To restore the tab, just click on the tab's preview.

tutorial_create_tab_group_description_2.message: 2. Type a name for your tab group, select a color and click on <kbd>Create</kbd>.

tutorial_create_tab_group_description_3.message: 3. Go to the %link% or any other website and preserve it.

tutorial_create_tab_group_description_5.message: 5. Right click on the tab group you created and click on <kbd>Restore</kbd>.

tutorial_create_tab_group_description_6.message: To move a tab to another group, simply drag it to the desired group.

tutorial_create_tab_group_description_7.message: If your browser supports tab grouping, you can also preserve the whole tab group by clicking <kbd>Preserve tab group</kbd> on any of group's webpages.

tutorial_settings_description_1.message: Look into the settings page and adjust Tabber look and feel to your liking.

tutorial_settings_description_2.message: Check out the <kbd>Auto preserve</kbd> section if you want to automatically preserve tabs.

tutorial_shortcuts_description_1.message: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts on the Tabber page:

tutorial_shortcuts_description_4.message: 3. <kbd>F11</kbd> or <kbd>F</kbd> to open Tabber in full screen.

tutorial_shortcuts_description_5.message: 4. <kbd>T</kbd> to restore the last closed tab.

tutorial_shortcuts_description_6.message: 5. <kbd>Ctrl + F</kbd> to search tabs. (<kbd>Esc</kbd> to exit)

tutorial_shortcuts_description_7.message: 6. <kbd>Ctrl + 1</kbd> to open Tabber from any page.

tutorial_shortcuts_description_8.message: You can also set your own global shortcuts in the settings.

tutorial_sign_in_description_1.message: Now you can log into your account to enable cloud backups, synchronizing data between devices and saving tab previews on the cloud without clogging up the device's memory.

tutorial_sign_in_description_2.message: This is optional, you can still use Tabber without logging in.

tutorial_sign_in_arrow_2.message: Click here to save backup to the cloud!

tutorial_menu_description_1.message: Click the ⋮ menu to access sorting, grouping, searching, and more!

tutorial_menu_description_2.message: You can also revisit this tutorial through the menu at any time.

auto_preserve_no_preserve_audible.message: Don't preserve tabs that are playing audio

auto_preserve_no_preserve_with_unsaved_f.message: Don't preserve tabs with unsaved form inputs

auto_preserve_no_preserve_when_offline.message: Don't preserve tabs when browser is offline

theme_background_description.message: Select a background for pages without previews

sites_whitelist_title.message: Never preserve tabs from these websites

sites_whitelist_description.message:
Add the URL of each page you want to whitelist on a new line. For example:
https://www.youtube.com/feed/subscriptions
https://mail.google.com
To whitelist multiple sites in one line you can specify part of the url instead:
google.com
You can also specify regex by enclosing the text in forward slashes:
/^https:.*google\.com/

groups_whitelist_title.message: Never preserve tabs from these groups

groups_whitelist_description.message:
Add the name of each group you want to whitelist on a new line. For example:
Work
Study
Entertainment
You can also select colors of groups that you want to whitelist.

ai_group_description.message:
You are going to group your tabs using AI, which will analyze their topics based on titles and links.
Before grouping, a backup of your current tabs will be created, so you can always roll back.
The number of requests is limited and depends on the number of your tabs. You can make approximately 2 requests per day with 50 tabs.
The AI model is not perfect and may make mistakes. You can always correct the grouping manually.
You can specify the group names that must be present. Specify them separated by line breaks, for example:
My Work
Study
Entertainment

share_tab_group_description.message:
Share this tab group with other people. Everyone with the link will be able to view and restore any tab from this group. Preview of tabs will be available only for you.
If you update this tab group, changes will be applied to all people who have access to it.
Also you can set a write access to allow other people to edit this tab group.

bind_sites_description.message:
List of sites that will be automatically added to this tab group when they are preserved. Add the URL of each page you want to bind on a new line. For example:
https://www.youtube.com/feed/subscriptions
https://mail.google.com
To bind multiple sites in one line you can specify part of the url instead:
google.com
You can also specify regex by enclosing the text in forward slashes:
/^https:.*google\.com/

review_dialog_description.message: You've been using this extension for a while now, and it seems like you like it! If that's the case, would you mind leaving a review in the store? It would really help me keep improving it. Thanks a lot!
